title: Ornn Short Story: The Lost Tales of Ornn
body: Behold some of the legends told about the mighty Ornn!

replies.body:
These stories are really written like ancient myths. They have the right tone for a myth and have gods shaping the world, committing accidental arson, and having family spats. Just the kind of stuff you'd see Zeus and his siblings doing. All in all?

Passable.

Both of Ornns siblings seem pretty jealous of him.

I didn't think {{champion:34}} to be such a bitch honestly. I always thought of her as wise, calm and gentle - not someone to keep a big accident a secret.
Also {{champion:106}} seems to be a douche and even steals Ornns armor. Voli fits into the "War Bear" Theme, but I always thought he was more...noble than that.  

Great stories overall, very well written and I enjoyed the read very much, but the content was a tiny bit disappointing in my opinion.

I agree that Anivia and Volibear's personalities seem quite different in these tales, but I'm glad, because it means they have actual depth as characters, rather than just being totally pure and noble, as their current in-game representations imply.

It truly feels kinda "Greek drama story" like Zeus so it could be all "fairy tales". Just there to make a good story for the Freljord folk, as mythology is most of the time.

While I think Volibear **needs** the gritty and slightly agressive touch, I never thought any of them to be the jealous type, a thief, or a coward.

######Also I think it is definetly weird that Voli grabs some random piece of armor. He's a bear goddamnit, he probably won't fit in it

Don't forget they're stories. They're high likely not 100% true. If Anivia keeps this accident as a secret, then how does grandma know? As the child said, most of stories are not completely true.

Stories usually have true points but they're stories in the end. They get affected by the teller.

There's a part of this story I don't really understand. It's about the Three Sisters.

If i got it right (and i think i probably didn't) the first sister was Serylda (fierceness and war, the Winter's claw is like that), the second was Avarosa (hope and wisdom, same for her clan) and the third was Lissandra (magic). Why would Lissandra, the third sister, seal the creatures they were fighting (the watchers) with her magic if she worships them?

Is she trying to win her sisters over so she could betray them, just putting the watchers to sleep, or does she have an agenda of her own? Either way, it doesn't sound like something Lissandra would do... if that's even her.

Remember, this is not Lissandra of modern day. Nor is it an accurate presentation of her motives. It is a story distilled by centuries of re-tellings. There are grains of truth here, they require a lot of work to get at though. 

I'm glad you have questions. It means the stories are working.

This is why I don't like the 'mythological' characters. I have no problem with myths and legends not being true, but when the only thing we know about a character is myth and legends, I don't bother to ask questions, I just assume that everything is fake and write the character off.

Irl, the Greeks used to look at Ares, God of War as a villainous god, depicting him as a coward and a jealous child. But he was the patron god of probably the most famous Greeks, the Spartans, who had a much better outlook on Ares. I bet it's the same here with Volibear; he represents war, so the faction that hates war depicts him in a negative light.
